book.title: QIICR
book.subtitle: Iowa Head and Neck Clinical Data DICOM SR Template

td.para: First draft delivered to Iowa for clinical data release to TCIA
Correct typos, add SCT and UMLS code links for use when comparing with ASCO HL7 CDA COTPS, add list of 99PMP codes used with placeholders for definitions and hyperlink from uses.

section.label: TID QIICR_2000
section.title: Clinical Data Report
section.para: This root template that encodes the clinical data for a patient.

td.para: DTID 1204 "Language of Content Item and Descendants"
EV (P1-65320, SRT, "Excision of cervical lymph nodes group")
EV (F-004ED, SRT, "Status of extra-capsular extension of nodal tumor")
Always (121049, DCM, "Language of Content Item and Descendants") = (eng, RFC3066, "English")
>HAS CONCEPT MOD (121046, DCM, "Country of Language") = (US, ISO3166_1, "United States")
Only (M, DCM, "Male") and (F, DCM, "Female") are used.

tr.td: Based on TID 3802 Cardiovascular Patient History, rows 12 and 15.
TID 3802 Row 14 has this as one of the concepts for a TEXT value drawn from CID_3774; we use a CODE instead

Nothing in DICOM yet, except as (C-F3310, SRT, "Chewing tobacco") in CID 6089 Substances invoked in DTID 9002 “Medication, Substance, Environmental Exposure” in TID 9007 General Relevant Patient Information
When no specific information is available, will be same concept for name and value (G-0133 = G-0133).

section.label: TID QIICR_2002
section.title: Biopsy
section.para: This template encodes information about a biopsy procedure.

section.label: TID QIICR_2003
section.title: Surgical Procedure for Head and Neck Cancer
section.para: This template encodes information about a surgical procedure for head and neck cancer.

table.label: TID QIICR_2003
table.caption: Surgical Procedure for Head and Neck Cancer

td.para: EV (P1-65325, SRT, "Block dissection of cervical lymph nodes")
EV (P1-03002, SRT, "Complete excision") is not quite right, because strictly speaking it applies to the organ

section.label: TID QIICR_2004
section.title: Radiotherapy Procedure
section.para: This template encodes information about a radiotherapy procedure.

section.label: TID QIICR_2005
section.title: Chemotherapy Procedure
section.para: This template encodes information about a chemotherapy procedure.

section.label: TID QIICR_2006
section.title: Tumor Pathology Results
section.para: This template encodes information about the pathology of a tumor.

td.para: EV (R-0026E, SRT, "Status of vascular invasion by tumor")
This template uses TID 4207 Breast Imaging Pathology Results as model.
The values are the same as DCID 6070, which is described as Bloom-Richardson Histologic Grade, which is breast-specific, though the code values, which are re-used here, are just ordinary AJCC.

TID 4207 (currently) uses (111471, DCM, "Involved") instead of (G-8DA4, SRT, "Surgical margin involved by tumor"), and (111470, DCM, "Uninvolved") instead of (M-09400, SRT, "Surgical margin uninvolved by tumor").
SNOMED "vascular" concept has children of large and small vessels, and latter includes lymphatic vessels.

section.label: TID QIICR_2007
section.title: Cervical Lymph Node Group
section.para: This template encodes information about a cervical lymph node group.

section.label: TID QIICR_2008
section.title: Diabetes Problem Properties
section.para: This template encodes information diabetes mellitus information for a problem list.

td.para: Correspond to rows 1, 4 (Problem) and 12 (Therapy) of TID 3829 "Problem Properties", and only (F-01000, SRT, "Problem) from is used in row 4
Alcohol intake above recommended sensible limits
Alcohol intake within recommended sensible limits
History of malignant neoplasm of head and/or neck
No history of malignant neoplastic disease
Extra-capsular extension of nodal tumor present
Extra-capsular extension of nodal tumor absent
Level I - Submental and submandibular lymph node group
Level II - Upper jugular lymph node group
Level III - Middle jugular lymph node group
Level IV - Lower jugular lymph node group
Level V - Posterior triangle cervical lymph node group
Cervical lymph node outside level I through V

note.para: In prior editions, this Context Group included the NCDR 2.0b codes as the primary set. These have been replaced with equivalent SNOMED codes.
In prior editions, this Context Group included the NCDR 2.0b codes as the primary set. These have been replaced with equivalent SNOMED codes.

section.label: CID 7455
section.title: Sex
section.para: This Context Group includes terms for the finding of sex of a subject for clinical purposes, such as selection of sex-based growth metrics.

listitem.para: These terms are distinct from the gender of a subject for administrative purposes, although the default value for clinical sex is often based on the administrative gender (e.g., see TID 1007 "Subject Context, Patient"). The administrative value "O" from Patient's Sex (0010,0040) maps by default to "undetermined" for clinical purposes.
This Context Group in a prior edition of the Standard included codes improperly attributed to ISO 5218.
These terms are derived from the terminology and codes for sex in ASTM E1633-02a "Standard Specification for Coded Values Used in the Electronic Health Record."
